document_title: What is the carotid artery? Causes, symptoms, diagnosis, treatment
subsection_name: dong-mach-canh.json_1_Symptoms of carotid artery disease are common
subsection_content:
Carotid artery disease refers to the narrowing of the carotid arteries, often due to the buildup of fatty and cholesterol deposits (plaque). When experiencing this condition, patients are at risk of stroke - the 5th leading cause of death in the US. (2)
Headaches, dizziness, and impaired vision can be a warning sign of the disease.
Symptoms of the disease may be absent. Sometimes, the first sign of the disease is a transient ischemic attack (TIA) or stroke. A TIA is a sudden, temporary loss of blood to an area of ​​the brain, usually lasting a few minutes to an hour. Symptoms disappear completely within 24 hours with complete recovery.
Symptoms of transient ischemic attack or stroke include:
Sudden weakness, clumsiness, or paralysis in one arm or leg; Loss of ability to move; Reduced ability to concentrate, or confusion; Headache, dizziness, fainting; Numbness or loss of feeling in the face or arms or legs; Blurred vision or temporary loss of vision; Inability to speak clearly or stuttering
subsection_title: dong mach canh.json. Symptoms of carotid artery disease are common
subsection_data:
